sleep-detection.title: Sleep Detection
sleep-detection.description: Here you can set up automations for enabling or disabling sleep mode automatically based on various triggers.

enableAutomations.title: Enabling sleep mode
enableAutomations.atBatteryPercentage: When a device's battery percentage falls below {{value}}%
enableAutomations.onControllersPoweredOff: When all controllers are turned off

disableAutomations.title: Disabling sleep mode
disableAutomations.onDevicePowerOn: When a device is turned on

enableAtTime.title: Enable sleep mode
enableAtTime.description: Enable sleep mode at a specific time of day.

disableAtTime.title: Disable sleep mode
disableAtTime.description: Disable sleep mode at a specific time of day.

sleepingAnimations.description: Oyasumi can automatically change your avatar animations when you change sleeping position. This can be useful if you don't have full body tracking, or if you (or you have Oyasumi) turn off your trackers during the night. See an example of what this could look like here. Presets are available for several pre-made avatar locomotion prefabs, but you can specify your own animations as well.

errors.releaseDurationTooShort: The release duration has to be at least 100ms.

positions.title: Sleeping Positions
positions.description: Set the OSC commands to activate the animation for each sleeping position.

footLock.title: Foot Lock
footLock.description: Set the OSC commands to enable and disable the foot lock.

general.title: General Options
general.onlyIfAllTrackersTurnedOff: If all trackers are turned off

footLock.title: Foot Lock
footLock.description: A foot lock commonly prevents the player from moving or rotating when it is enabled.

general.lockFeetOnSleepModeEnable: Lock feet when sleep mode is enabled
general.unlockFeetOnSleepModeDisable: Unlock feet when sleep mode is disabled
general.unlockFeetOnAutomationDisable: Unlock feet when disabling automatic sleeping animations
general.releaseFootLockOnPoseChange: Momentarily release foot lock when switching sleeping positions

devicePowerOff.title: Turning off devices
devicePowerOff.description: Various automations for turning off your SteamVR devices.

onSleepModeEnable.title: When I go to sleep
onSleepModeEnable.description: Turn off devices when sleep mode is enabled.
onSleepModeEnable.hint: You can configure when sleep mode is enabled in Sleep Detection.

onCharge.title: When charging them
onCharge.description: Have devices turn off automatically when you put them on the charger.

gpu-automations.title: GPU Automations
gpu-automations.description: Here you can automate the power limits of your GPU, to save on electricity while you are asleep.

disabled.initializing: GPU Automations are currently still initializing...
disabled.disabled:
Oyasumi allows you to automatically tweak the power limits of your GPU.
This way you can save on your electricity usage while you're asleep.

GPU Automations are currently only available for NVIDIA GPUs.
AMD and Intel GPUs are still unsupported.
disabled.noElevation: For Oyasumi to be able to control the power limits of your GPU, it requires administrator privileges. Please click the button below to give Oyasumi administrator privileges.
disabled.driverNotLoaded:
Oyasumi did not detect a loaded NVIDIA driver.

Please ensure your system has a NVIDIA card and the appropriate drivers for it installed.
disabled.noDevices:
No graphics cards could be found in your system.

Please ensure your system has a NVIDIA card and the appropriate drivers for it installed.
disabled.unknown: An unknown error occurred trying to enable the GPU automations feature.

gpu-automations.enableWarning:
This is a feature for advanced users!
Incorrectly configuring your power limits could lead to your system becoming unstable.
Please keep this in mind and ideally only use this if you know what you are doing.
gpu-automations.selectGPU: Select the GPU you wish to set the power limit for:
gpu-automations.gpuPowerLimitsUnsupported: The selected GPU does not support setting power limits.

activatingSleepMode.title: When I go to sleep
activatingSleepMode.description: Specify the power limit to set when sleep mode activates:

deactivatingSleepMode.title: When I wake up
deactivatingSleepMode.description: Specify the power limit to set when sleep mode deactivates:

gpu-automations.enabledWarning: Please be aware that setting your power limits too low could result in your system becoming unstable. Disable this feature if you do not know what you are doing.
gpu-automations.inputDefault: Reset to the GPU's default limit.

elevationSidecarModal.title: Give administrator privileges
elevationSidecarModal.message:
Do you want to always give Oyasumi administrator privileges?

If you enable this, Oyasumi will immediately ask for them when starting. You can disable this later at any time in the settings.

status-automations.title: Status Automations
status-automations.description:
Oyasumi can limit the amount of people who join you, by automatically setting your status
      based on how many players there are in your world.
status-automations.loginRequired: This feature requires you to be logged in with a VRChat account.
status-automations.exampleUse:
Example use: When someone joins you, automatically switch your status to orange or red!
When they leave and you are alone again, automatically switch your status back to blue so someone else can join you.
status-automations.disableToEdit: Please disable status automations before you make any changes.
status-automations.onlyIfSleepModeEnabled: Only when sleep mode is enabled
status-automations.behaviourWarning: Status changes by Oyasumi are not visible to the player. Even to other players, it can take a bit of time for a status update to show. This is a limitation of the VRChat and cannot be fixed by Oyasumi.
status-automations.behaviourWarningFAQ:
Here you can find the answers to some questions you might have about the status change behaviour:

Q: Can I still automatically accept invite requests, even if VRChat does not show that I am on blue?
A: If you have Oyasumi set your status to blue (join me), it will take over the responsibility of automatically accepting any invite requests you receive.

Q: People cannot join me because my status does not update for them.
A: Status updates can take a while to be shown to other users. If they want to join you but can't, they can force your status to refresh by opening your profile in the main menu.

language.title: Language
language.description: You can select your desired language here. If there are any missing translations, or you would like like to add support for your language, please get in contact!

lighthouseConsole.title: Lighthouse Console
lighthouseConsole.description: Oyasumi needs to know about the location of your SteamVR installation's lighthouse_console.exe. If Oyasumi cannot find it in the default location, you need to set where it can be found.

status.NOT_FOUND: The lighthouse_console.exe could not be found at this location.
status.INVALID_EXECUTABLE: The lighthouse_console.exe at this location could not be verified as working.
status.PERMISSION_DENIED: Oyasumi does not have permission to run the lighthouse_console.exe at this location. Try running Oyasumi as administrator.
status.INVALID_FILENAME: The set location is not a valid file path.
status.UNKNOWN_ERROR: An unknown error occurred while trying to look for lighthouse_console.exe at this location.
status.SUCCESS: lighthouse_console.exe has been found and is working correctly!

adminPrivileges.title: Administrator Privileges
adminPrivileges.label: Ask for administrator privileges on startup
adminPrivileges.description: Oyasumi needs administrator privileges to be able to control your GPU's power limits. If you enable this, Oyasumi will ask for administrator privileges when it starts up.

telemetry.title: Telemetry
telemetry.label: Send anonymous usage data
telemetry.description: The data that will be sent is limited to the version of Oyasumi that you are using, and the language you have set. No other data is sent and it is completely anonymous. This data is only used for providing some general usage statistics.

logIn.title: Log in
logIn.description: Some Oyasumi features require you to log in with your VRChat account for them to work.

loggedIn.title: Hi {{name}}!
loggedIn.subtext: You are currently logged in with your VRChat account.

loggedOut.title: Logged Out
loggedOut.subtext: You are currently not logged in with your VRChat account.

errors.initError: The VRChat module could not be initialised. Please ensure you have internet connectivity and restart Oyasumi at a later time to try again.

disclaimers.use: Your login credentials will never be stored anywhere and are only ever sent to VRChat's servers for authentication purposes.
disclaimers.brand: Oyasumi isn't endorsed by VRChat and doesn't reflect the views or opinions of VRChat or anyone officially involved in producing or managing VRChat. VRChat is trademark of VRChat Inc. VRChat Â© VRChat Inc.
disclaimers.liability: Raphiiko is not not responsible for any problems caused by Oyasumi. Use at your own risk!

updates.noUpdate: You are currently running Oyasumi v{{version}} which is the latest version!
updates.notChecked: Oyasumi did not check for updates yet.
updates.updateAvailable:
A new version of Oyasumi is available! You are currently running v{{currentVersion}}.
The newest version is v{{latestVersion}}.

debug.description: On this page you can find some debug tools. You should not need these, but especially with Oyasumi still being in early testing, they're here if you need them.

persistentStorage.title: Persistent Storage
persistentStorage.description: These buttons help you clear parts of Oyasumi's persistent storage. Use this if you wish to restore defaults in case of an error occurring.

language.title: Language
language.description: This option allows you to manually load a language file. This can be useful for testing new translations.

error.title: Update Failed
error.message: The update failed to install. Please try again later.

misc.GOGO_LOCO_LEGACY_PRESET_WARNING: This preset uses a workaround that has some issues. Please only use this preset if you can't use the newer GoGo Loco preset. If your avatar still uses an older version of GoGo Loco, it is recommended that you update your avatar to use the latest GoGo Loco version.

oscScriptEditorErrors.noFloatMilliseconds: Millisecond values have to be defined as a whole number.
oscScriptEditorErrors.durationTooShort: Sleep duration must be at least 1ms.
oscScriptEditorErrors.totalDurationTooLong: The total script duration cannot exceed 10 seconds.
oscScriptEditorErrors.intOutOfBounds: The value must be a valid integer between 0 and 255.
oscScriptEditorErrors.floatOutOfBounds: The value must be a valid float value between -1.0 and 1.0.
oscScriptEditorErrors.floatTooPrecise: The value can only have a precision of 3 decimals maximum.
oscScriptEditorErrors.tooManyCommands: An OSC script cannot have more than {{value}} actions.
oscScriptEditorErrors.addressNoSlash: A valid OSC address must always start with a '/' symbol.
oscScriptEditorErrors.addressNotASCII: A valid OSC address must only contain ASCII characters.

update-modal.title: Update Available
update-modal.message:
A new update for Oyasumi has been found: v{{newVersion}}.

You are currently still running v{{currentVersion}}.

Do you want to update now or later?

action.none: No actions have been added yet!

SLEEP.title: Sleep
SLEEP.description: Wait for a specified amount of time

errors.CHECK_EMAIL: Login failed: For details, check the mailbox of the e-mail address that is tied to your VRChat account.
errors.INVALID_CREDENTIALS: The credentials you have provided are incorrect.
errors.UNEXPECTED_RESPONSE: Login failed: an unknown error occurred. Please verify your connection or try again later.

vrchat-login-tfa-modal.title: Two Factor Authentication
vrchat-login-tfa-modal.description:
Your VRChat account is protected with two factor authentication.

Please enter a 2FA code:

errors.LAST_CODE_INVALID: The 2FA code you have provided was incorrect.
errors.INVALID_FORMAT: A valid 2FA code is a sequence of 6 numbers. Please verify your input.
